1601.name: Unknown
1601.message:
Unable to find a Wi-Fi network.

Please confirm that your Wi-Fi
network is set up for use and that
the SSID has been set correctly.
You can check the Wii U SSID
settings under the Internet option
in System Settings.

If the settings are correct and this
problem occurs, the network may be
busy or the signal strength may be
poor. Wait for a few minutes, and then
try again, making sure that there are no
obstructions between the console and
the network device.
1601.short_description: There is likely a poor wireless signal between the console and the Wi-Fi router.
1601.long_description: (CONNECTION SLOT 1) There may be a poor wireless signal between the console and the Wi-Fi router or the SSID has been entered incorrectly.
1601.short_solution: Make sure your console is in range of your Wi-Fi network, and check the settings are correct. Make sure the 'Default' connection in Internet Settings is set correctly. Power cycle the modem/router or try again later.
1601.long_solution: Make sure your console is in range of your Wi-Fi network, and check the settings are correct. Make sure the 'Default' connection in Internet Settings is set correctly. Power cycle the modem/router or try again later. Also ensure that there aren't too many devices connected at once and that there aren't any large objects containing metals or other electronic devices between the console and the router that could interfere with connection.
